Module: j5e/led

Description

Class library for controlling LED's (Light Emitting Diodes). Connect the LED to a digital IO for on/off functionality. Use a PWM IO for varying brightness.

Requires

  • module:j5e/animation
  • module:j5e/easing
  • module:j5e/fn

Class: LED

The LED class allows for control of Light Emitting Diodes

Constructor

new LED()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
io
(required)
number
string
object
Pin identifier or IO Options (See {@tutorial C-INSTANTIATING})

Examples

Using a pin number
import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12);
led.on();
Using a pin identifier string
import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED("A1");
led.on();
Using device options
import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12);
led.configure({
  pwm: true
});
led.on();

Properties

Name
Type
Description
value
(read only)
number
The current value of the LED
isOn
(read only)
boolean
Wether the LED is on
isRunning
(read only)
boolean
True if the LED is blinking, pulsing or animating

Methods

configure

Configure an LED

led.configure()

Returns: The instance on which the method was called

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
options
(required)
object
Device configuration options
options.sink
number
True if an element is wired for sink drive

Example

import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(14);
led.configure({
  sink: true
});

// With sink: true, led.on() sets pin 14 low
led.on();

write

Internal method that writes the current LED value to the IO

led.write()

on

Turn an led on

led.on()

Returns: The instance on which the method was called

Example

import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12);
led.on();

off

Turn an led off

led.off()

Returns:

Example

import LED from "j5e/led";
import {timer} from "j5e/fn";

const led = await new LED(12);
led.on();

// Wait one second and turn the led off
timer.setTimeout(function() {
  led.off();
}, 1000);

toggle

Toggle the on/off state of an led

led.toggle()

Returns:

Example

import LED from "j5e/led";
import {timer} from "j5e/fn";

const led = await new LED(12);
led.toggle(); // It's on!

// Wait one second and turn the led off
timer.setTimeout(function() {
  led.toggle(); // It's off!
}, 1000)

blink

Blink the LED on a fixed interval

led.blink()

Returns:

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
duration
(required)
Number
Time in ms on, time in ms off
Default: 100
callback
(required)
function
Method to call on blink

Example

import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12);
led.blink(1000);

brightness

Set the brightness of an led

led.brightness()

Returns:

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
value
(required)
Number
Brightness value [0, 1]

Example

import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12, {
  pwm: true
});
led.brightness(0.5);

intensity

Set the brightness of an led 0-100

led.intensity()

Returns:

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
value
(required)
Integer
Brightness value [0, 100]

Example

import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12, {
  pwm: true
});
led.intensity(50);

fade

Fade an led from its current value to a new value (Requires ```pwm: true```)

led.fade()

Returns:

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
val
(required)
Number
Target brightness value
time
Number
Time in ms that a fade will take
Default: 1000
callback
function
A function to run when the fade is complete

Example

import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12, {
  pwm: true
});
led.fade(512);

fadeIn

fadeIn Fade an led in to full brightness (Requires ```pwm: true```)

led.fadeIn()

Returns:

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
time
Number
Time in ms that a fade will take
Default: 1000
callback
function
A function to run when the fade is complete

Example

Fade an LED to full brightness over half a second
import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12, {
  pwm: true
});
led.fadeIn(500);

fadeOut

fadeOut Fade an led out until it is off (Requires ```pwm: true```)

led.fadeOut()

Returns:

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
time
Number
Time in ms that a fade will take
Default: 1000
callback
function
A function to run when the fade is complete

Example

Fade an LED out over half a second
import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12, {
  pwm: true
});
led.on();
led.fadeOut(500);

pulse

Pulse the LED in and out in a loop with specified time using ```inOutSine``` easing (Requires ```pwm: true```)

led.pulse()

Returns:

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
time
number
Time in ms that a fade in/out will elapse
Default: 1000
callback
function
A function to run each time the direction of pulse changes

Example

Pulse an LED on a half second interval
import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12, {
  pwm: true
});
led.pulse(500);

animate

Animate the LED by passing in a segment options object

led.animate()

Returns:

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
options
(required)
Object
(See {@tutorial D-ANIMATING})

Example

Animate an LED using an animation segment options object
import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12, {
  pwm: true
});
led.animate({
  duration: 4000,
  cuePoints: [0,  0.33, 0.66, 1],
  keyFrames: [0, 0.75, 0.25, 1],
  loop: true,
  metronomic: true
});

stop

stop Stop the led from blinking, pulsing, fading, or animating

led.stop()

Returns:

Example

Pulse an LED and then stop after five seconds
import {timer} from "j5e/fn";
import LED from "j5e/led";

const led = await new LED(12, {
  pwm: true
});
led.pulse(500);

// Stop pulsing after five seconds
timer.setTimeout(function() {
  led.stop();
}, 5000);

normalize

led.normalize()

Parameters

Name
Type
Description
number || object
keyFrames An array of step values or a keyFrame objects

render

led.render()
